info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 12:46PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL WASHINGTON AND SOUTHWESTERN ALLEGHENY COUNTIES THROUGH 130 PM EDT... At 1245 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wolfdale, or near Washington, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, McMurray, McKeesport, Washington, Canonsburg, Avella, Gastonville, West Mifflin, Baldwin, and Upper St. Clair. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 28. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 32 and 62. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 61 and 71. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
